condition.description:
Cystic fibrosis (CF) is an inherited disease of the mucus and sweat glands. It affects mostly your lungs, pancreas, liver, intestines, sinuses and sex organs. CF causes your mucus to be thick and sticky. The mucus clogs the lungs, causing breathing problems and making it easy for bacteria to grow. This can lead to problems such as repeated lung infections and lung damage.

The symptoms and severity of CF vary widely. Some people have serious problems from birth. Others have a milder version of the disease that doesn't show up until they are teens or young adults.

Although there is no cure for CF, treatments have improved greatly in recent years. Until the 1980s, most deaths from CF occurred in children and teenagers. Today, with improved treatments, some people who have CF are living into their forties, fifties, or older.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
condition.name: Cystic fibrosis

carousel_items: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Azithromycin is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease, myasthenia gravis, or on medications to thin the blood, as the doctor may write an alternative.
downsides: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

downsides_processed.orig: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

drugs.name: Azithromycin

off-label_indications.indication: STI prevention for victims of sexual assault

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening of myasthenia gravis
risks_warnings.description: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

description_processed.orig: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

carousel_items: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Avoid taking this by itself with dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt) or with juice with calcium.
Take this medication at least 2 hours before or 6 hours after any antacids with magnesium or aluminum or with any vitamins with calcium, iron or zinc.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Limit your caffeine intake while taking this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Ciprofloxacin is a good and cheap antibiotic to treat many types of bacterial infections. However, you have to reduce your caffeine intake, and have to protect yourself from the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
If you have caffeine while on Ciprofloxacin, you may noticed increased effects of the caffeine.
Ciprofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.

downsides_processed.orig: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
If you have caffeine while on Ciprofloxacin, you may noticed increased effects of the caffeine.
Ciprofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

userStories.tip: Gave me anxiety attacks, low blood sugar, wrist pain, rapid heart beat, insomnia, and popping sounds in different parts of my body.  After 3 days, I never felt like I was getting better, only worse.  I'm never taking it again.
Tore rotator cuff, still healing months later

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Destroyed my digestive system gut flora in the process.. It's not just about possible diarrhea when you are on it...the side effects can last weeks. I'm still trying to get my digestive system working properly again.

drugs.name: Cipro

off-label_indications.indication: Infection or inflammatory reaction from an artificial joint or implant or graft

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Avoid taking this by itself with dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt) or with juice with calcium.
Take this medication at least 2 hours before or 6 hours after any antacids with magnesium or aluminum or with any vitamins with calcium, iron or zinc.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Limit your caffeine intake while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Tendon rupture
risks_warnings.description: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening of myasthenia gravis
risks_warnings.description: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

description_processed.orig: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Ciprofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Ciprofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage and it can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage and it can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Ciprofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Ciprofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Ibuprofen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, but it doesn't last as long as other NSAIDs.
downsides: Ibuprofen doesn't work as long as other NSAIDs, so follow the package directions on how often you can take it.
It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Ibuprofen doesn't work as long as other NSAIDs, so follow the package directions on how often you can take it.
It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Ibuprofen works as well as aspirin in treating pain and causes fewer stomach problems.
Ibuprofen works better than acetaminophen (Tylenol) at lowering fever and relieving sinus pain.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.

Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

userStories.identifier: swim coach with severe whiplash damage
userStories.tip: Can make you slightly more susceptible to have a mild episode if you are asthmatic - make sure you have your inhaler available when you are taking large doses for prolonged periods.
It can definitely make you feel out of it, but sometimes that's a good thing.
Make sure you eat before taking ibuprofen. It will make you very nauseous and woozy otherwise.
Not suitable for all copd or asthma sufferers but for those who can be prscribed it is wise to be prescribed omeprazole or alternative med to help protect the stomach and esophagus from acid reflux.
It gives increased risk of ulcers
Works well at the onset of a common cold. Usually ok taking a bit more than the suggested dose.

Taking in the morning or afternoon with an hour of two for relax before takes effect. If you have ocular / eye problems / pains you will feel in 10 minutes that your whole body starts to relax but keep away from computers, tv and so.

drugs.name: Ibuprofen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Ibuprofen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Ibuprofen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Ibuprofen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Ibuprofen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Ibuprofen. Don't take Ibuprofen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Ibuprofen.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Ibuprofen. Don't take Ibuprofen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Ibuprofen.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Ibuprofen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Ibuprofen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Ibuprofen for any amount of time.

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Ibuprofen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.
